description: Users may experience instability in Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) version 122.0.2365.52 due to the underlying heap corruption associated with a use-after-free issue in the Mojo component of Chromium. This instability could manifest as unexpected crashes or failures while loading specific web pages, potentially leading to a diminished browsing experience. Users might notice delays or non-responsiveness when accessing websites crafted to exploit this specific vulnerability. The latest security update from Microsoft addresses this issue, ensuring improved stability and security for users operating with Edge version 122.0.2365.52 as of February 23, 2024, and should be installed promptly to mitigate these observed behaviors.
